main event: A retired Brigadier General observed a bright, round light moving at a high velocity over Wichita, Kansas on April 15, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright light, round in shape, and appeared to be moving at a high velocity.
The object was observed on two separate occasions within about one minute, with the second sighting seen simultaneously by the observer and his wife.
The object's movement was described as a 'streak of light' traveling a curved course at a very high rate of speed, approximately 200-300 miles per hour.
The observer estimated the object's altitude to be around 500 feet and the distance to be approximately 1500 feet.
No noise was heard during the sightings, and there was no appearance of flames or discoloration, ruling out a jet or combustion engine.
photographs: yes, but they did not show the objects clearly
